com.mvp4g.client.event
Class EventBus

java.lang.Object
  com.mvp4g.client.event.EventBus

public class EventBus
extends java.lang.Object

This class is in charge of dispatching an event to the right presenters thanks to commands

Author:
plcoirier

Method Detail

dispatch

public void dispatch(java.lang.String eventType,
                     java.lang.Object form,
                     boolean storeInHistory)
Execute the command associated with the event type in order to trigger the presenters that can handle the event. Forward to the handler the object associated with the event.

Store the event in GWT History stack if needed and possible. If an event can't be stored in GWT History stack (ie when no History Converter has been associated to the event), the method will not try to store in GWT History stack even if storeInHistory is true.

Parameters:
eventType - type of the event to dispatch
form - form to forward to the handlers
storeInHistory - indicates if the event must be stored in the GWT History stack. This parameter matters only if the event can be stored in the GWT History stack (ie if a History converter is associated with the event).
Throws:
Mvp4gException - exception thrown in case an error occurs while the event is dispatched.
The most common cases that this error could be thrown is in case:
  • the type of the event can't be handled by the event bus because no command is associated to it.
  • the class type of the object to be used by the handler methods is different from the class type of the handlers method.
This exception shouldn't be caught. If this exception is raised, it means that there is an error in the application that needs to be fixed (most of the time, an error in the configuration file).

dispatch

public void dispatch(java.lang.String eventType,
                     boolean storeInHistory)
Execute the command associated with the event type in order to trigger the presenters that can handle the event. In this case no object is forwarded to the handler(s).

Calling dispatch(eventType) is equivalent to calling dispatch(eventType, null, storeInHistory).

Parameters:
eventType - type of the event to dispatch
storeInHistory - indicates if the event must be stored in the GWT History stack. This parameter matters only if the event can be stored in the GWT History stack (ie if a History converter is associated with the event).
Throws:
Mvp4gException - exception thrown in case an error occurs while the event is dispatched.
The most common cases that this error could be thrown is in case:
  • the type of the event can't be handled by the event bus because no command is associated to it.
  • the class type of the object to be used by the handler methods is different from the class type of the handlers method.
This exception shouldn't be caught. If this exception is raised, it means that there is an error in the application that needs to be fixed (most of the time, an error in the configuration file).

dispatch

public <E extends java.lang.Enum<E>> void dispatch(java.lang.Enum<E> enumEventType,
                                                   java.lang.Object form,
                                                   boolean storeInHistory)
Execute the command associated with the event type in order to trigger the presenters that can handle the event. Forward to the handler the object associated with the event.
In this function, the type is given as a enumeration. The toString method of this enumeration must return the type of the event defined the configuration file.

Calling dispatch(enumEventType, form) is equivalent to calling dispatch(enumEventType.toString(), form, storeInHistory).

Parameters:
enumEventType - type of the event to dispatch
form - form to forward to the handlers
storeInHistory - indicates if the event must be stored in the GWT History stack. This parameter matters only if the event can be stored in the GWT History stack (ie if a History converter is associated with the event).
Throws:
Mvp4gException - exception thrown in case an error occurs while the event is dispatched.
The most common cases that this error could be thrown is in case:
  • the type of the event can't be handled by the event bus because no command is associated to it.
  • the class type of the object to be used by the handler methods is different from the class type of the handlers method.
This exception shouldn't be caught. If this exception is raised, it means that there is an error in the application that needs to be fixed (most of the time, an error in the configuration file).

dispatch

public <E extends java.lang.Enum<E>> void dispatch(java.lang.Enum<E> enumEventType,
                                                   boolean storeInHistory)
Execute the command associated with the event type in order to trigger the presenters that can handle the event. In this case no object is forwarded to the handler(s).

In this function, the type is given as a enumeration. The toString method of this enumeration must return the type of the event defined the configuration file.

Calling dispatch(enumEventType) is equivalent to calling dispatch(enumEventType.toString(), null, storeInHistory).

Parameters:
enumEventType - type of the event to dispatch
storeInHistory - indicates if the event must be stored in the GWT History stack. This parameter matters only if the event can be stored in the GWT History stack (ie if a History converter is associated with the event).
Throws:
Mvp4gException - exception thrown in case an error occurs while the event is dispatched.
The most common cases that this error could be thrown is in case:
  • the type of the event can't be handled by the event bus because no command is associated to it.
  • the class type of the object to be used by the handler methods is different from the class type of the handlers method.
This exception shouldn't be caught. If this exception is raised, it means that there is an error in the application that needs to be fixed (most of the time, an error in the configuration file).

dispatch

public void dispatch(java.lang.String eventType,
                     java.lang.Object form)
Execute the command associated with the event type in order to trigger the presenters that can handle the event. Forward to the handler the object associated with the event. The event is automatically stored in GWT History stack if possible (ie if an History Converter is associated with the event) Calling dispatch(eventType, form) is equivalent to calling dispatch(eventType, form, true).

Parameters:
eventType - type of the event to dispatch
form - form to forward to the handlers
Throws:
Mvp4gException - exception thrown in case an error occurs while the event is dispatched.
The most common cases that this error could be thrown is in case:
  • the type of the event can't be handled by the event bus because no command is associated to it.
  • the class type of the object to be used by the handler methods is different from the class type of the handlers method.
This exception shouldn't be caught. If this exception is raised, it means that there is an error in the application that needs to be fixed (most of the time, an error in the configuration file).

dispatch

public <E extends java.lang.Enum<E>> void dispatch(java.lang.Enum<E> enumEventType)
Execute the command associated with the event type in order to trigger the presenters that can handle the event. In this case no object is forwarded to the handler(s).

In this function, the type is given as a enumeration. The toString method of this enumeration must return the type of the event defined the configuration file.

The event is automatically stored in GWT History stack if possible (ie if an History Converter is associated with the event)

Calling dispatch(enumEventType) is equivalent to calling dispatch(enumEventType.toString(), null, true).

Parameters:
enumEventType - type of the event to dispatch
Throws:
Mvp4gException - exception thrown in case an error occurs while the event is dispatched.
The most common cases that this error could be thrown is in case:
  • the type of the event can't be handled by the event bus because no command is associated to it.
  • the class type of the object to be used by the handler methods is different from the class type of the handlers method.
This exception shouldn't be caught. If this exception is raised, it means that there is an error in the application that needs to be fixed (most of the time, an error in the configuration file).

addEvent

public void addEvent(java.lang.String eventType,
                     Command cmd)
Add a new event type that can be managed by the event bus by associated a command to the new event type. If the event type was already present, it replaces the old command by the specified command.

Parameters:
eventType - New event type
cmd - New command associated to the event type
